items.abstract: <jats:p>There are good reasons to think that mothers love their children, and love them for who they are. There are also good reasons to think that contingent events can decisively influence who one becomes. This entails, I argue, that your mother does not love you for who you are.</jats:p>
title: YOUR MOM DOES NOT LOVE YOU FOR WHO YOU ARE

items.abstract: <jats:p>Many are unwilling to donate their vital organs in death. To affirm this choice is to prefer the integrity of one's corpse over possibly saving and improving the lives of others. This position enjoys no sound defence. Refusing to donate amounts to a gratuitous moral failure.</jats:p>
title: ORGAN DONOR OR GRATUITOUS MORAL FAILURE? PICK ONE
